title: Chiel Meijering: Two Men and a Lady/Amsterdam Guitar Trio (1990)
description:
CHIEL MEIJERING
Two Men and a Lady

"Although the Amsterdam Guitar Trio's recordings have concentrated on transcriptions of classical music such as Vivaldi's Four Seasons, Bach's Brandenburg Concertos and the piano music of Debussy, FaurÃ© and Chopin, those who have attended their concerts know that they are champions of modern music as well. There is rarely a concert by the trio that does not have at least one new piece by the exciting contemporary Dutch composer Chiel Meijering.
This album is in response to all those fans of the trio who have requested recordings of Meijering's work.
It is a selection from the 20-odd works that Meijering wrote for the Amsterdam Guitar Trio in the period 1980-1989. Of the seven works on this album, five were presented by the Trio on their 1987 concert tour, which featured an all-Meijering program accompanied by viola player Esther Apituley and soundscape composer Floris van Manen."

1. Are You Afraid of the Dark? Part 1 [3:23]
2. Are You Afraid of the Dark? Part 2 [3:54]
3. Two Men and a Lady [5:52]
4. No Rhyme No Reason Part 1 [3:31]
5. No Rhyme No Reason Part 2 (Winds of Change) [5:35]
6. Miss Garcia Doesn't Ring Anymore 7:04
7. Another Day Dies on a Gull's Cry [6:41]
8. The Insects Are Coming [5:36]
9. No Rhyme No Reason Part 3 (Dreamtime) [9:52]
Total Playing Time: 52:10

Recorded January 2-6, 1989, Evangelical Lutheran Church, Haarlem, The Netherlands
Produced by the Amsterdam Guitar Trio/Johan Dorrestein
